intro: Cayratia kiujiangensis, commonly known as the Kiujiang climbing vine, is a species native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
